user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_init_mem_pools_:
```c
void
MHD_init_mem_pools_ (void)
{
#ifdef MHD_SC_PAGESIZE
  long result;
  result = sysconf (MHD_SC_PAGESIZE);
  if (-1 != result)
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) result;
  else
    MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#elif defined(_WIN32)
  SYSTEM_INFO si;
  GetSystemInfo (&si);
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) si.dwPageSize;
#else
  MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t) MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_;
#endif /* _WIN32 */
  mhd_assert (0 == (MHD_sys_page_size_ % ALIGN_SIZE));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_init_mem_pools_:
#define MHD_SC_PAGESIZE _SC_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define MHD_DEF_PAGE_SIZE_ _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
static size_t MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t)
#if defined(MHD_USE_PAGESIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGESIZE;
#elif defined(MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGE_SIZE;
#else  /* ! MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC */
                                   _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
...
#define ALIGN_SIZE (2*sizeof(void*))
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
static size_t MHD_sys_page_size_ = (size_t)
#if defined(MHD_USE_PAGESIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGESIZE;
#elif defined(MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC)
                                   PAGE_SIZE;
#else  /* ! MHD_USE_PAGE_SIZE_MACRO_STATIC */
                                   _MHD_FALLBACK_PAGE_SIZE
explanation: Other fragments in the provided code (function signature, braces, simple local declarations and simple casts/assignments outside the listed preprocessor/initialization/assertion parts) do not warrant investigation for unreachable-code under MISRA Rule 2.1 because they are syntactically required and are not conditional or otherwise prevented from executing in the compiled translation unit. The suspect regions listed above cover: (a) all conditional compilation branches that determine which code is actually compiled (these must be checked to ensure no branch is effectively dead in the project configuration), (b) the static initializer that may make runtime initialization redundant, (c) the assertion macro definition that is a no-op, and (d) the alignment macro used in the assertion. Other lines not listed are simple, unconditional statements or declarations that are reachable in the compiled output and therefore do not represent unreachable code for purposes of Rule 2.1.
